sentences.sContent: He stared at her, but there was no sign of recognition .
sentences.sCn: 他盯着她看，但似乎没认出她来。

sentences.sContent: ...a clear recognition of self orientation and personal interest will decide whether you will tick the box of vocational college or university...
...a company with its focus on social media to boost its brand recognition stands a better chance of standing out from the crowd...

...I'm hoping to get a better grip on some of the questions raised by the data revolution: In what situations should we rely on intuitive pattern recognition and in which situations should we ignore intuition and follow the data...
...Employees who receive a very favorable evaluation may deserve some type of recognition or even a promotion...
...and a slow recognition that workers have lives beyond the office—all are strong arguments for letting staff work from home...

synos.tran: [计][免疫]识别；承认，认出；重视；赞誉；公认

phrases.pCn: 公众认识阶段；公共认可，公众接受度

words.tran: 可辨认的；可认识的；可承认的
认识；意识到（recogniz的过去分词）
承认；认出；辨别（recognise的过去分词）

trans.tranOther: the act of knowing someone or something because you have known or learned about them in the past
